title: How Fast Can a Leopard Run? It's Slower than Most of Its Prey
body: African leopards have a top speed of 56-60 km/h (35-37 mph). That's significantly slower than cheetahs and lions, as well as being slower than a lot of its prey. But this top speed isn't the full story. The leopard is one of the greatest predators on the African savannah and speed is just one piece of its hunting prowess.

title: How Fast Are Leopards? Top Speeds and How It Compares ... - AZ Animals
body: Tigers can run between 30-40 miles per hour, and lions 50 miles per hour. Snow leopards are not much faster than their "regular" leopard relatives, maxing out at around 40 miles per hour. How Fast is a Leopard Compared to a Human? The fastest human runner, Usain Bolt, maxes out at 27.5 miles per hour.

title: How fast can a leopard run per hour? - Quick-Advice.com
body: The average top speed of a leopard is 35 miles ( 56 kilometers) per hour. If a leopard is particularly hungry, they can go even faster and even reach up to 40 miles ( 64 kilometers) per hour. Talk about a need for speed!
